Supported platforms: Windows XP and later; Windows Server 2003 and later
Auto defrag when idle: {{Yes|Yes  with Windows Task Scheduler}}{{efn|name="ScheduleIdle"|Windows Task Scheduler "Idle" schedules and options settings will be applied to scheduled tasks.}}

Scheduler: {{Yes|Yes  with Windows Task Scheduler}}{{efn|Defraggler's GUI only provides an interface to configure defragmenting activity in Windows Task Scheduler.[3]}}

Supported platforms: Windows NT 4 and later; Windows 95 and later

Scheduler: {{Yes}}{{efn|Condusiv Technologies claims its InvisiTasking technology eliminates the need for scheduled defragmentation.}}
